meanings.sent1: The shiny globe rolled off the table.
meanings.sent2: She held the colorful globe in her hands.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat batted the globe around the room.
meanings.sent4: His head felt like a heavy globe after a long day.
meanings.sent5: The glass globe sparkled under the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: We live on this vast globe called Earth.
meanings.sent2: The globe rotates on its axis, causing day and night.
meanings.sent3: The globe is like a giant playground for all living creatures.
meanings.sent4: Her love for the globe knows no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The globe is a beautiful blue and green sphere in space.

meanings.definition: A representation of the earth in the form of a sphere
meanings.sent1: The globe on her desk showed all the countries of the world.
meanings.sent2: He studied the globe to learn about different continents.
meanings.sent3: The globe on the shelf seemed to spin on its own.
meanings.sent4: The globe in the classroom helped students understand geography better.
meanings.sent5: She dreamt of traveling to every place marked on the globe.
